instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.8v
threads.message:
a lot of water damage spots on the board.
clean all and now try to see if it can be fixed.
no short on big coils.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.8v

ub3200
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> - 0v

<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL>- 0v

UB400
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 1.1v

UB300
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 1.1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage 5v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.8v
threads.message:
Still problems on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 area.
Check all adjacent resistors and <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> traces/solders.
